intro: Swainsona leeana, commonly known as the yellow bell tree, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is characterized by its striking yellow, trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant is a member of the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and it has compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets. Swainsona leeana is often found in coastal and sandy soils, thriving in well-drained conditions. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and landscaping.
